title: Tupelo National Battlefield: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           2083 Main St  Tupelo, MS 38801                 Directions         Tupelo National Battlefield (NB) is a one-acre monument located on Main Street, Tupelo, Mississippi. Main Street in Tupelo is also known as Highway 6 and Highway 278. Tupelo NB sits on the south side of Main Street on the west side of Tupelo. Exit off the Natchez Trace Parkway onto Highway 6 (near Milepost 260), head east, into Tupelo. Travel one mile east and find Tupelo NB on the right side of Main Street. There is limited parking available adjacent to the monument.  Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Tupelo National Battlefield Site The grounds of Tupelo National Battlefield are open during daylight hours everyday of the year. The National Park Service administers the National Battlefield through the Natchez Trace Parkway. Visitors are welcome to ask questions and learn more about the battlefield at the Parkway Visitor Center (Milepost 266) located about six miles north of the monument. The Visitor Center is open every day of the year except December 25, 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m. (Central Time).   Standard Hours    Sunday: Sunrise - Sunset   Monday: Sunrise - Sunset   Tuesday: Sunrise - Sunset   Wednesday: Sunrise - Sunset   Thursday: Sunrise - Sunset   Friday: Sunrise - Sunset   Saturday: Sunrise - Sunset             Weather           Mississippi is classified as a humid subtropical climate, the weather ranges from mild winters to hot summers with high humidity between May and September. Average high temperatures reach into the high 80's in summer, and into the high 40's in winter. Check local forecasts to plan your trip.         Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   No entrance fee - $0.00 There are no fees to visit Tupelo National Battlefield. Enjoy your visit!         Visitor Centers       Natchez Trace Parkway Visitor Center The National Park Service administers the National Battlefield through the Natchez Trace Parkway. Visitors are welcome to ask questions and learn more about the battlefield at the Parkway Visitor Center (Milepost 266) located about six miles north of the monument. The Visitor Center is open every day of the year except December 25, 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m. (Central Time). The Natchez Trace Parkway can be reached at 800-305-7417.                This small site commemorates the battle of Tupelo and the individuals who lost their lives in the battle. NPS Photo       Tupelo National Battlefield Site is a one-acre commemorative site located along Main Street in Tupelo, Mississippi. The battlefield site is open from sunrise to sunset every day. There are no visitor facilities at the battlefield; you may consider visiting the Natchez Trace Parkway Visitor Center located along the Parkway at Milepost 266 near the intersection of Highway 145 (Gloster St.) and the Parkway. The Visitor Center is open 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. (Central Time) every day except December 25. The Visitor Center has literature and information about the battle. For more information, or to receive a brochure about the battle, call the Visitor Center at 800-305-7417. You may also consider visiting the other interpretive sites which help tell the story of the battle of Tupelo. To learn more about these sites and the Battle of Tupelo, you may visit the Mississippi's Final Stands Interpretive Center.
